snippet: Thanks to a provision in the merger of the N.B.A. and the A.B.A. in 1976, former A.B.A. team owners Ozzie and Daniel Silna have earned $255 million from the N.B.A.’s television contracts.
abstract: Ozzie and Daniel Silna, former American Basketball Assn team owners, have earned $255 million from the NBA's television contracts, thanks to a provision in the merger of the two leagues in 1976; now the Silna brothers have filed a lawsuit hoping to tap into the money the league gets from international broadcasts, NBA TV and other lucrative deals.
lead_paragraph: Thanks to a provision in the merger of the N.B.A. and the A.B.A. in 1976, former A.B.A. team owners Ozzie and Daniel Silna have earned $255 million from the N.B.A.’s television contracts.

headline.seo: Former A.B.A. Owners Ozzie and Daniel Silna Earn Millions From N.B.A.
headline.main: No Team, No Ticket Sales, but Plenty of Cash
headline.print_headline: No Team, No Ticket Sales, but Plenty of Cash
